fields.description:
h3. Problem
When exporting the work log, it is only possible to export the total time spent on issues, but not the comments on the work log.

h3. Suggested resolution
Provide the ability to export work log comments.
fields.summary: Ability to export work log comments

fields.description: Currently, any project if moved to trash would notify all trusted users and site admins saying "XXX has moved the project to Trash" however ability to control who all should be notified might help the customers.
fields.summary: Trash feature - Notifications sent out should be customisable

fields.description:
The default group should be added while creating a new next-gen project. This could be customized from the Admin page. This feature is available in the classic project.

Like _jira_administrator_ can be set as default group to be added in *Access* page once any new next-gen project created.

!Default group.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Nex-gen project to have default group while project creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The 'Available Streams' option in the Activity Stream gadget is missing in certain instances. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Activity Stream gadget in a Jira dashboard.
# Edit the gadget in order to see the possible options.

h3. Expected Results
The *Available Streams* option to filter only Jira or Confluence activity should be available:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
In some instances there is no such option:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

Its a regression bug for JRACLOUD-69856
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The 'Available Streams' option in the Activity Stream gadget is missing and the gadget only shows Confluence activity.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

{{jira.comment.collapsing.minimum.hidden}} setting in Jira's advanced settings doesn't work for the new issue view. It would be great if this setting works, or an alternative way is provided to achieve this.
h3. Why is it important?

Sometimes the agents and admins don't want to have to click to view more comments and want to have all comments being shown in the issue view.
h3. Suggested resolution

Enable the {{jira.comment.collapsing.minimum.hidden}} setting to the new issue view.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to control the number of comments to collapse

fields.description:
h3. Use case

As an API user, I want to be able to use the Jira platform add/update comment APIs to set visibility (as an agent or collaborator would do from the issue view).

h3. Solution

Currently the API returns a {noformat}jsdPublic{noformat} attribute in the comment API responses. The reciprocal attribute could be exposed as a writeable attribute.

h3. Workaround

Use the Jira Service Desk REST API to add/update comments and set visibility: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-issueIdOrKey-comment-post
fields.summary: Add support for setting comment visibility to Jira platform REST API add/update comment API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The type ahead menu from the advanced issue search experience floats on top of the global horizontal navigation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to issues and filters
 # Switch to advanced search
 # Start typing to trigger type-ahead search of something like issueType
 # Note windows scrolls up...
 # Select your entry from type-ahead list
 # Note that advanced search query is not visible; it is now hidden behind the top-nav bar
 # Scroll page down to access the query

h3. Expected Results

Type-ahead menu should not float above the global horizontal navigation.
h3. Actual Results

Type-ahead menu floats above the global horizontal navigation.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Menu from the JQL query on the Advanced issue search page floats on top of navigation

fields.description:
Ability to view Weblinks from Jira Cloud

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to view Weblinks from Jira Cloud for Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new navigation view is focused on helping users to find their work/tasks. However, it is not very friendly with administrators, the icon from the top-right panel might be a little bit poor for that purpose. 
h3. Current Experience

Only the icon from the right-top menu, which is poor in options. 
h3. Suggestion(s)
 * *Add a history of the recently visited places such as filters*. this will help to save a lot of time. 
 * Add a *Setting menu* to the top panel, where the administrator finds the settings of Issues, Jira Settings, Global Settings. 

h3. Workaround

If you're a site administrator, use the `.` menu to get around the system settings and configurations. 

!admin dot dialog.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve Top menu in the New Navigation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting the comment of a ticket, the comment field expands a lot and cover some of the ticket content. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira issue on a testing project
# In the comment, type "enter" and create a lot of new lines.
# The comment expands a lot and cover some of the ticket content. 

h3. Expected Results
The comment doesn't move. 
h3. Actual Results
comment expands a lot and cover some of the ticket content. 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inserting lots of new line in comment covered some of the ticket content.

fields.description:
At the moment the JSON importer logs does not indicate if a new jira issue has been created or an existing issue has been updated. 

 !sample.png|thumbnail! 

In the sample above, all three items has been successfully processed by the importer. 1 new issue has been created and 2 existing issues has been updated. There is no clear indication which issues has been updated or created. 

Debugging becomes really hard when importing hundreds of issues because of the lack of details in the log. 

*Suggestion* :

For each item processed by the importer, specify the following in the logs :
1. SKIPPED or IMPORTED - to specify if there was any failure 
2. For IMPORTED issues - specify if a new issue is created or  an existing one has been updated. 
3. Specify the Jira issue key for readability.
fields.summary: Provide a more detailed logging for the JSON importer

fields.description:
h2. Summary

@mentioned user in a comment is not parsed through automation rule to send the slack notification. Instead of showing username, it is displaying userID.
h2. Steps to reproduce:

*1. Create an automation rule:*
 When: Issue commented
 Then: Send Slack message
{code:java}
The ticket {{issue.key}} -{{issue.summary}} has got a new comment by {{comment.author.displayName}}
{{comment.body}}
{code}
*2. At Jira-Issue comment section*
 Mention a user in Jira issue comment
{code:java}
@<username> This is test-1 to check your name appearing on the slack channel.
{code}
*3. Slack channel*
 The slack channel is popping up with the notification triggered via automation rule with the below information.
{quote}Automation for Jira [8:24 PM]
 *The ticket BS-61 -Re: CLOSED TEST Jira auto1 has got a new comment by MSood*
 [~accountid:xxxxxxxxxxx] This is test-1 to check your name appearing on the slack channel.
{quote}


h2. Expected Result:

Instead of [~accountid:xxxxxxxxxxx], a username should appear.
h2. Actual Results:

[~accountid:xxxxxxxxxxx] is appearing.
h2. Workaround:

No workaround available at present
fields.summary: @mentioned user in a comment is not getting parsed through automation(A4J)

	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)

{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The incoming mail handler configuration shows the username of the default reporter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the incoming mail admin screen [/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa|https://jdog.jira-dev.com/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa]
 # Click add incoming mail handler
 # Choose Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue
 # Click next
 # Choose a person for the default reporter. Here it will show the display name of the person, which is fine.
 # Choose save
 # Now back on the previous screen, under Mail Handlers, it shows "Default Reporter: username" where username is the username of the person you chose on the previous screen.

h3. Expected Results

Default reporter should show the user's display name or full name. (depending on the configuration)
h3. Actual Results

The account's username is shown. Usernames should never be shown in the UI.
h3. Workaround

To get more information on the Default Reporter, you need to open the configuration.
fields.summary: The incoming mail handler configuration shows the username of the default reporter

fields.description:
Whenever an attempt to create a project via POST /rest/api/3/project is performed passing non existing IDs in the body parameters, the error message displayed as response is *Internal server error* rather than indicating what could be causing the issue.

It would be nice if we could have a graceful message stating that the issue relies on the IDs passed that don't match the existing ones for the respective Jira Cloud instance.
fields.summary: Enhance error message for POST /rest/api/3/project when body parameters IDs are wrong

fields.description:
For Structure Cloud advise customers that the data within that add-on is not backed up to the Jira backup.

h3. Problem Definition
ALM Works Structure Cloud add-on doesn't have the functionality to backup/restore their structure data and it doesn't make it into the Jira backup either.

h3. Suggested Solution
Advise the Customer during a backup if they have this add-on that the data provided by the add-on will not be saved into the backup.

h3. Why this is important
The vendor has advised the customer of this after the customer already invested time with the Cloud add-on and was expecting to see the data in the backup. Here is the response from the vendor to the customer.
{code}
Hello Customer,

Thank you for your request.

Structure Cloud doesn't have the Backup functionality yet, so I afraid it is not possible to migrate Structure data from Cloud to Server We have plans on implementing migration from Server to Cloud, it is on our roadmap and is expected to be released in the future.

Unfortunately, it is unclear yet if the reversed migration from Cloud to Server will be supported since Cloud architecture is substantially different from Servers and there can be limits for implementing certain functionalities in the same way.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
ALM Works
{code}

h3. Workaround 
There is no workaround provided by the vendor.
fields.summary: For Stucture Cloud advise customers that the data within that add-on is not backed up to the Jira backup.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The user selection text box on the watcher page of Jira's old view disappears once the "Watch issue" button is clicked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the issue in the old view
 # Remove all watcher from the issue from the main page and make sure there is no watcher added
 # Click on more (...) and then select Watcher
 # The watcher page will open and provide _user selection_ text to provide input
 # Click on _Watch issue_ button
 # The page will refresh and _user selection_ text will now disappear

h3. Expected Results

Jira page having problem is  - /secure/ManageWatchers!default.jspa /secure/ManageWatchers!default.jspa 
 !Expected result.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
 !Actual Result.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Users can use the Manage watcher option available on the issue view page.
fields.summary: Manage Watcher page does not work in old view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to upload custom priority icons of SVG format
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the SVG file as an attachment to an issue.
# Copy the attachment URL and use this URL to change the priority icon

h3. Expected Results
The Priority icon is successfully changed
h3. Actual Results
The Priority icon is broken when using an SVG file attachment.

h3. Workaround
Use files of PNG format.
fields.summary: Uploading SVG file format as custom priority icons is not working

fields.description:
An automation rule is configured for the Project where:

1. Issue is transitioned from Status1 to Status2
2. A transition screen pops up with a "User picker Field"
3. Field is assigned with a value
4. Automation rune that is supposed to pick the value of the above field and put is as Issue Assignee.

When automation run and issue is assigned, the results are not replicated on the screen immediately, until the issue is manually refreshed.

Note: This is sometimes intermittent and the Field Assignee does actually get updated sometimes immediately.

The above is because all Automation rules in cloud always run asynchronously, which means you can never guarantee the page to be refreshed.


It would be nice to to have these automation Rules run within the process (like they do in Server) so that the changes get reflected immediately.
fields.summary: Screen is not refreshed as soon as an Automation rule runs

fields.description:
From a Customer:
For a Jira automation rule that updates multiple tickets in one execution, is there a way to share the consolidated list of all the tickets via slack/ email? With the current implementation, I have a separate notification that is triggered for each ticket updated individually, and flooding the slack and mailbox.
fields.summary: Automation rule to send consolidated list of all the updated tickets via slack/ email?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The user base is not syncing to Jira and new users are unable to authenticate

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an user
# Delete the user
# Recreate the user
# User tries to authenticate

h3. Expected Results
User is able to login

h3. Actual Results
User don't have access to the site

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: The user base is not syncing to Jira and new users are unable to authenticate

fields.description: As the reporter or assignee of a Jira ticket transitions to another status, this is recorded in the ticket's history section. Please provide an option in Automation for Jira to extract the reporter's or assignee's name from this section.
fields.summary: Ability to extract reporter's or assignee's name from the history tab of Jira tickets

fields.description: Please add the ability to upload pictures or files during transitions on the mobile app, just like how you can do it on desktop. Our users frequently forget to attach things because it is not present on the transition screen.
fields.summary: Mobile App: Ability to Upload Attachments During Transitions

fields.description: There is already *History* tab for this feature in every issue. But we would like to have a JQL to fetch the list of *assignee* for the issue rather than going and opening every issue and then clicking on *History* tab to see.
fields.summary: Need JQL to fetch the list of assignee for an issue.

fields.description:
It is seen that for in certain use cases, issue id is showing up instead of the issue key. So it is difficult for the user to understand the history of the issue from the issue history section.

 An example is given below.

1) Create a story and two epics in a next-gen software project.
2) Make the first epic as the parent of the story using the "Change Parent" option available in the 3 dots on the top right(pic1.png, pic2.png)
3) Check the history section of the story. Instead of epic issue key, issue id is shown.(pic3.png)
4) Change the parent of the story to the second epic using the "Change Parent" option. (pic4.png)
The epic issue ids are shown up instead of epic issue keys(pic5.png).

The workaround is to use REST API, GET /rest/api/3/issue/issueIdOrKey or  contact Altassian Support to get the Issue Key from the database.
fields.summary: Issue id is showing up instead of Issue key in Issue history for epic changes in next-gen projects

fields.description:
When creating a new Jira ticket, the ticket creation prompt fills the entire screen. 
The user is not able to use the background page (scroll on the board, read existing tickets, etc.).

We'd like to have an option to create a draft ticket, meaning, to open a ticket as usual with the current creation prompt, but being able to hide it and return to it later.

For reference, Gmail's automatic drafting capabilities for emails works wonderfully.
fields.summary: Comfortably hide tickets as you open them (Draft tickets)

fields.description: for elgawla project
fields.summary: elgawla project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using "WAS" operator with a predicate pointing to a time frame before field of interest was first modified, no results are returned.

Documentation has an imprecise statmenet on it:
{quote} This operator will match the value name (e.g. "Resolved"), which was configured in your system _at the time that the field was changed_.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue.
 # Next day (or more), change issue resolution to "Resolved" and back to "None". 
 # Issue two searches with JQL as below, but:
 ## First JQL with a date the day SAME or LATER as creation date, but EARLIER the first change of "resolved" field.
 ## Second JQL with a date AFTER the change from "Resolved" to "None"

{code:java}
resolution was EMPTY ON "2020-02-04"
{code}
h3. Expected Results

Both JQL queries should be returning created issue.
h3. Actual Results
 # First JQL: created issue is not on the list
 # Second JQL: created issue is not on the list

h3. Workaround

Initial "Resolved" field value can be changed for future WAS searches to work

CHANGED operator can cover some of the cases, e.g.:
{code:java}
resolution changed from empty after "2020-02-04"{code}
fields.summary: JQL "WAS" predicate does not show results when predicate points to a timeframe before a field was first changed

fields.description:
Plugin information is maintained by the Universal Plugin Manager. This is currently provided by the UPM REST API, [documented here|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/display/UPM/UPM+REST+API].

But if we compare with the Server version (check this [documentation here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-access-upm-rest-api-for-license-details-777021716.html]), the Cloud version shows less information.

It would be great if this could be improved.
fields.summary: Improvement on the UPM REST API for Cloud

fields.description:
It would be nice if the customer has the ability to add a condition in the custom field to appear randomly. 
For example: There is a custom field for bugs issue type. But the customer just want this custom field to appear for some users (random), not all.
fields.summary: Ability to add a condition in the custom field to appear randomly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since many integrations are listening to the default Jira events: Created, Updated, Resolved, etc when you change it by a custom user event the Jira automation rules stop being triggered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom event. 
 # Edit the create transition, set the custom event.
 # Create one rule automation with Create issue as the trigger

h3. Expected Results

The rule should be executed.
h3. Actual Results

The rule is not executed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Having a custom event in workflows breaks automation rules.

fields.description:
In a scenario in which a parent issue has way too many children to be displayed, the page load of the parent issue view is drastically impacted.

We had a case that an Epic had 1122 child issues and that would make the Epic issue view load to take up to ~45 seconds to load.

This could be addressed by creating some sort of pagination that would only display the first set of child issues at first and have an option to the see the next page and so on just like filter results are made.
fields.summary: Issue View should load children section with pagination to improve performance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the *Filter Results* gadget, the epic colors shows are different from the colors set in epics and in filter results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few epics with different epic colors
# Search for the epics on Jira and add *Epic name* field to the list view to view the epic colors
# Save the search results as a filter 
# In a dashboard, add *Filter Results* gadget and choose the filter created in step 4
# In the gadget, add Epic name field and you could see that the epic colors shown are different from the colors shown in search results

h3. Expected Result
The epic colors shown in the gadget should be the same as the colors selected while creating epics

h3. Actual Result
Epic colors shown in the gadget are different from the colors shown in search results

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Filter Results gadget shows different epic colors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Blockquotes not rendering correctly for the Old issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a comment using the blockquote wiki markup { quote }

h3. Expected Results
It should show the following result:
{quote}Test{quote}
h3. Actual Results
Shows the following:
"Test"

h3. Workaround

Turn on the Jira labs (New issue view) and use the *+* sign to add a Quote panel.
fields.summary: The Block quotes (surrounded by {quote}) not rendering correctly for Old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The more smart links added to a comment or description of an issue, the longer the new issue view takes to load and get interactive

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any issue with the New Issue View on
 # Add a single comment with 20 Smart Links to the same issue or any other one you prefer or add some smart links in the Description field
 # Post the comment
 # Reload the page

h3. Expected Results
Page should have a similar load time as the old issue view.

h3. Actual Results
Page takes a long time to load and to get interactive.
Video attached below demonstrating the issue:
 [^SmartLinksPerformanceTestBento.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Disable Jira Labs through the toggle button in your personal settings.
fields.summary: The more smart links added to an issue, the longer the new issue view takes to load and get interactive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira Cloud today, when a Jira admin wants to create a new priority and give that priority an icon, they only ever seen the same five default icons (blocker, critical, major, minor, trivial). They cannot see exactly what existing options are available to them. This particular feature appears to be a hold-over from Jira server where administrators have an expectation to know the filepath of the icon images they would want to use. However Cloud site-admins do not have this ability, and in turn they are unable to select from the available existing icons.

If an admin should ever delete an existing priority, say Low or Medium, then when they try to create a new replacement priority they don't actually see those as options either.  Even though these are default icons that are included in every Jira Cloud site today.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a Jira admin go to the priorities .atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
 # Go to Add a new priority section
 # Click the 'select image' link there a popup will appear

h3. Expected Results

Expect that admins can see all the available icons they could choose from.  At the very least all the defaults that come with Jira, but also any custom icons that might have been added too.
h3. Actual Results

User only sees the same 5 default options, regardless of what icons actually exist in Jira, and regardless of what priorities are already defined.

!sameiconoptionsalways.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Admins can still select existing icons, but they have to know the name of the file to choose, such as:
 * blocker.png
 * blocker.svg
 * critical.png
 * critical.svg
 * high.png
 * high.svg
 * highest.png
 * highest.svg
 * low.png
 * low.svg
 * lowest.png
 * lowest.svg
 * major.png
 * major.svg
 * medium.png
 * medium.svg
 * minor.png
 * minor.svg
 * trivial.png
 * trivial.svg

Without entering the exact filename, you cannot add this icon back to Jira easily.  And furthermore this workaround is not ideal because the user can't see exactly what that icon looks like until after the priority is created.
fields.summary: Choosing an icon when creating a priority does not show you all available icons

Currently, there isn't a way for us to trace who deleted the issue type from the project settings. There wouldn't be any notification when this happens either from the UI or the API.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Symptom: When an issue that has issue security level set is being moved to an other project, after moving the issue "disappears", it will not be possible to view it.
 Reason: while moving the issue between projects there is no check for permission for the set issue security in destination project. The issue will have an issue security level that belongs to the source project, not available in the target project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # choose 2 projects that have different security scheme
 # move an issue from one to the other

h3. Expected Results

The issue should have a valid security level and should be visible after moving.
h3. Actual Results

the issue cannot be accesses after moving

https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~248273509/pages/757613043/Root+Cause+of+DOS+Escalation+JRACLOUD-74250

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
 N/A, moving is actually successful
h3. Workaround

Remove issue security level before moving the issue or enable the set issue security permission for the user in both projects (source and destination) in which user is trying to move the issues.
fields.summary: When moving issue between projects, there is no check for permission to set issue security in destination project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Refering to the [Create issues using the CSV importer|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/create-issues-using-the-csv-importer/] documentation , it doesn't mention about the executor only able to fill in the value for the field available in "Create Issue" screen. For user related field, for example "Reporter" field only can be updated by project administrator or agents (for JIRA Service Desk project).

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation with the information below :-

{panel}
User executed the import only able to fill in the field value available in "Create Issue" screen. For other fields , for example "Status" , "Reporter" and "Assignee" , only the project administrator or agents (for JIRA Service Desk project) can update it.
{panel}

h3. Why this is important
It's clear to the users which field they fill in using the "Import Issue" feature in the "Create Issue" screen.
fields.summary: Update "Create issues using the CSV importer" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By now, if an issue has a summary like GTP.BUG4875 and the user search for "BUG" this issue won't appear in the results unless the word "BUG" is also present in another field as description, for example.

This happens because by now Jira cannot break the words like GTP.BUG4875 into smaller tokens.
h3. Workaround

You can search for "BUG" using the following query:
{code:java}
project = XXYY and text ~ "BUG*" {code}

h3. Issue Summary

JIRA search does not ignore the accents of words. Thus, it is difficult to find users / issues / projects that have accents in their names.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue that has an accent in its name
 # Go to basic search
 # Try to find it without writing the accents (e.g. notificação > notificacao)

You can reproduce it either with projects or users.
h3. Expected Results

Being able to search for accented words without having to actually write with accents. JIRA should be sensitive to accents:
||Accented letters||Should be recognized when writing||
|à â ä ã á|a|
|ê é è ë|e|
|î ï í|i|
|ó ô õ|o|
h3. Actual Results

JIRA can't find words with accents if you don't write them.
h3. Workaround

Users need to write the accents of these words in order to find them
fields.summary: Allow search feature to ignore accents

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Epic Link* field, you can select epics from different projects to link an issue to.

In order to have the link persist, you need to have the *Edit issues* permission in both projects.

The current problem is that currently, the behaviour is misleading. Even though you don't have the necessary permission in the project where the desired Epic is, the field Epic Link will display it, and you can select it. 
But, the change will not persist, and an entry will be created in the issue history:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-16 at 08.00.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Navigate to an issue in a project where you have the *Edit issues* permission;
* Edit that issue's Epic link, and search for an Epic that belongs to a project where you don't have the *Edit issues* permission.

h3. Expected Results

That Epic should not be displayed since you don't even have the necessary permissions to have the change persist.

h3. Actual Results

You can select the Epic, and an entry will be created in the issue's history. 

The change will not persist.

That whole scenario is misleading for customers since they won't be even prompted with an error message.

h3. Workaround

If you are running into that problem with a user, make sure to grant the necessary permissions in both projects.
fields.summary: Epic link searcher displays Epics from projects where you don't have the Edit Issues permission

h3. Issue Summary

For Automation rules, if a custom event is set to be fired through a post-function, the Issue Transitioned trigger does not work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom event as a post-function
 # Build a rule with Issue Transitioned trigger, specifying the transition in which the post-function mentioned in "1" was added.

h3. Expected Results

The rule should be triggered.
h3. Actual Results

Jira doesn't send webhooks for transitions configured with post-functions in which custom events are fired, so Automation app is not notified and the rule is not triggered.

h3. Workaround

Change the Event triggered by your workflow post-function back to Generic Event (make sure to check if this won't impact notifications or integrations).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a ticket is added or removed to sprints in Jira, the issue history shows the changes to the _list of sprints_. This list of sprints includes all sprints the ticket was part of until the sprint was closed (the inactive sprints) and the current active sprint it is part of.

For example, if a ticket was part of _Sprint A_, _Sprint B_ (inactive) and is part of _Sprint C_ (active) and is removed from Sprint C while it's active, history will show:
* Sprint A, Sprint B, Sprint C -> Sprint A, Sprint B

{panel}
_Note that this is when changing sprints while the sprint is active. If the ticket is moved to backlog or another sprint upon the sprint's closure, it won't show any history items for it, as the ticket remains in the sprint_
{panel}

This may be misleading to users, as it does not clearly shows what sprint is active or inactive in the history item. Someone looking at the history may mistakenly think the issue was added to Sprint B in this operation, while it was only removed from Sprint C.

h3. Suggested Solution

Show sprint history by separating the closed sprint list from the active sprint in history items with square brackets or parentheses. The example above would be, for example:
* [ Sprint A, Sprint B ], Sprint C -> [ Sprint A, Sprint B ]

We can clearly see the Sprint C was the active one and it was removed. 
 
h3. Workaround 

There is no workaround, but the easiest way to avoid misinterpretations of the history is to:
* Always check for what changed from the old to the new values (in that example, Sprint A and Sprint B are in both old and new values, so they didn't change)
* Know that only the active sprint will actually change, so pay attention to the last sprint in the list.
fields.summary: Better distinguish active and inactive sprints in issue history

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The REST API endpoint [POST /rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/remotelink|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-remotelink-post] permits remote links to be created with a summary. This summary is displayed when the new issue view is turned off. However in the new issue view this summary cannot be displayed.
h3. Suggested Solution

Display the link summary next to the link title on the page.
h3. Why this is important

The REST API permits this data to be stored, and classic view displays it as expected, it remains inconsistent behavior to capture such data and never reveal it to the end user in any way in the new issue view.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Remote links or web links should display the link summary in new issue view

fields.description:

E-mail notifications aren't sent to me when I make ticket changes by default, but jirabot does by default and also doesn't present the option to ignore those.

At the end, I would like to receive notification for any changes made to the tickets configured, as long as those changes were initiated by someone other than myself.
fields.summary: Allow exclude author initiated changes

<instance>/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypeScreenSchemes.jspa

The screen schemes should be listed alphabetically

None

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes, users might experience performance problems within Jira.

But, there are no metrics that can be analysed from the users' side, which creates the need of contacting the support.

h3. Suggestion

Provide the ability of monitoring such metrics to admins, that way they might not need to contact the Cloud support.

If they see that the metrics are good, they can go ahead and investigate possible environment problems (e.g. network).
fields.summary: Ability to monitor performance metrics

fields.description:
As a Jira admin, I should be able to restrict creating and managing global rules to just Jira admins, since for project admins it is harder to see the magnitude of global actions. And while project admins are only responsible for their project(s), the Jira admin is responsible for all projects (on a high level).

Also, since the amount of times you can run global rules is limited, based on your license, a Jira admin should be able to have some control over this.

When a project admin has come up with a rule that seems destined for greatness, it may be brought to the attention of the Jira admin, who will most certainly recognize this unicorn rule and will promote it from project to global.
fields.summary: It should be possible to restrict creating and managing global rules to jira admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The date picker is showing the incorrect value when looking at the new issue view history tab, it is showing -1day.

If we enter 2020/06/17, the issue history tab shows 2020/06/16

It happens with any "Date Picker" type custom field.

Note: This issue only affects the new Jira issue view, the old Jira issue view works fine.

!Screen Shot 2020-06-11 at 21.29.00.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-11 at 21.29.07.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project.
 # Create a new "Date Picker" custom field.
 # Associate the new "Date Picker" custom field with the new project screens.
 # Create a new issue for this new project.
 # Enter any date for the new "Date Picker" custom field.
 # Look at the history tab (new Jira issue view)
 # It will display 1 day earlier than you entered in the "Date Picker" custom field.

h3. Expected Results

The issue history tab should display the same value that you set for the "Date Picker" custom field.
h3. Actual Results

The issue history tab displays 1 day less than the "Date Picker" custom field.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround using the new Jira issue view, but you can switch to the old Jira issue view.
fields.summary: The date picker field is showing the incorrect data when looking at the new issue view history tab.

fields.description: When searching through the JQL in queue view, the label column when empty displays "none" text to report. It would be better if no text is displayed.
fields.summary: Remove "None" text from labels, when the field is empty.

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Jira administrators are no longer able to export workflows, the export option is now restricted to Site administrators.

The UI shows the following message:
 *"You don't have permission to export the workflow. Contact your site admin to export the workflow for you."*

  !Screen Shot 2020-06-11 at 18.43.04.png|thumbnail!

According to the documentation [Importing and exporting issue workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-and-exporting-issue-workflows-962965084.html], Jira administrators should be able to extract workflows, however, this documentation was last modified on Dec 17, 2018.

It looks like a regression, Jira administrators used to be able to export workflows.

It may be related to [JRACLOUD-73902 - Cannot export workflow from Jira settings as Workflow|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73902]
h4. Workaround

Contact a site administrator, site administrators can still export workflows.
fields.summary: Jira administrators are no longer able to export workflows.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when a user copy and paste a link from a ".com" instance to any other instance domain it will not load the smart-link view {key-issuenum}{Summary}{Status} but it will display only the hyperlink.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy an issue link from an instance with ".com" domain
# Paste it on the comments within the same instance or another instance with different domains ".net"

h3. Expected Results
It should create a smart-link showing the following information {key-issuenum}{Summary}{Status}

h3. Actual Results
It will only display the hyperlink to the ticket.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround available as this is not supported yet, this was confirmed by the Editor team who is in charge of smart links.

Task has been created on their board for this issue.
fields.summary: Support smart-links for ".com" domains

N/A

{noformat}
"generation_failure" in Sparkpost logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Based on [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-create-issues-using-direct-html-links-in-jira-server-159474.html] documentation, user are allow to create issue via HTML/URL. The URL template are {{[JIRA BASE URL]/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?[ARGUMENTS]"}}. However, when adding a exist issue for *issuelinks-issues* argument , it doesn't add the issue in the field. It only adds if the issue do not exist in the instance and it will throw an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue via HTML/URL with issue linked (https://<JIRABASEURL>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10102&issuetype=10109&description=Test&summary=Test&=&issuelinks-linktype=blocks&issuelinks-issues=TIG-83) . Make sure issue TIG-83 existed.

h3. Expected Results
Issue TIG-83 updated in "Issues" field

h3. Actual Results
The field not updated :-
 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 2.28.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
If use a non existed issue , it will update the field and throw error :-

 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 2.30.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add {noformat}issuelinks-issues=REMOVETHIS{noformat} in the URL. It will throw error , however the existed issue will be updated in the "Issues" field. The user have to manually remove the "REMOVETHIS" from the "Issues" field before click *Create* :-

https://<JIRABASEURL>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10102&issuetype=10109&description=Test&summary=Test&=&issuelinks-linktype=blocks&issuelinks-issues=TIG-83&issuelinks-issues=REMOVETHIS

 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 2.33.17 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Linked issue are not added when creating issue via "CreateIssueDetails" HTML/URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue types in Next-gen are scope restricted (tied to the project they were created in).

But, it is possible to associated those issue types to Classic projects, which can cause problems such as the inability to update affected issues via CSV.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a CSV file with two columns: Summary, Issue type;
* Populate both columns:
** In the Issue type column (that will be mapped to the issuetype field during the import), put the id of a Next-gen issue type.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not accept that value if it makes reference to a Next-gen project.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is created, and the issue type is added to the issue type scheme.

That may cause some problems. 

The one I confirmed so far, was the inability to update issues (that are associated with that issue type) via CSV.

h3. Workaround

In case you notice that scenario, change the issue types of the affected issues.

If the issue type is still displayed in the issue type scheme(s), edit the issue type scheme:
* The issue type will not be displayed on the edit page, but clicking un *Save* will update the issue type scheme, removing that issue type from the issue create's issue type list.
fields.summary: It is possible to add Next-gen issue types to Classic projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Update project|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?&_ga=2.190389675.1439258687.1591691160-1080961822.1564054573#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-put] REST API endpoint (PUT /rest/api/3/project/\{projectIdOrKey}) fails in FREE instances returning status 400 (bad request) and below error message:
{quote}"Changing permission schemes is not allowed on the Jira Software or Core Free plans."
{quote}
 

This is because  [Project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-permissions-776636362.html], [roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-roles-776636382.html], and [issue-level security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html] aren't configurable when you're on the Free plan. For details see:
 *  [Project permissions, roles, and issue-level security in Free plans|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/project-permissions-roles-and-issue-level-security-in-free-plans-976780344.html] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a REST API request to update a project description text against a standard (non-free) Cloud site and see that it works as expected: {noformat}
curl -u <EMAIL-ADDRESS>:<API-TOKEN> -H 'Accept: application/json' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data '{"description": "TEST DESCRIPTION"}' -X PUT "https://STANDARD.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/TSP"

{"expand":"description,lead,issueTypes,url,projectKeys,permissions,insight","self":"https://STANDARD.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/10000","id":"10000","key":"TSP","description":"TEST DESCRIPTION",......
{noformat}
 # Now try to use the same REST API endpoint to update the description of a project on a FREE Cloud site

h3. Expected Results
It works the same way it worked for the standard site and the project description is successfully updated

h3. Actual Results
The request fails returning:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages": ["Changing permission schemes is not allowed on the Jira Software or Core Free plans."], "errors": {}}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Update project permissions from the UI.
fields.summary: Update project REST API endpoint (PUT /rest/api/3/project/{projectIdOrKey}) does not work in free instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a mail handler, you can select a default reporter that will create issues on behalf of users that don't have a Jira account or permissions within the project.

Currently, the behaviour seems inconsistent. Specially for existing users that don't have permissions within the target project. 
Jira will use the default reporter to create the issue for those users, but not the attachments.

Here are the scenarios I tested, along with their results:
{panel}
 * When sending an email from a non-Jira user:
 ** Issue was created by the default reporter with attachment (/).
 * Jira user created, but has no permissions in the project:
 ** Issue created by default reporter without attachment (i);
 * Deactivated user (neither product access nor site access):
 ** Issue created by default reporter with attachment (/).
 * Site access toggled on but no product access:
 ** Issue created by default reporter, without attachment (i).
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a mail handler pointing to a project;
** Set a default reporter on that mail handler (make sure the default reporter has all the necessary permissions within the project).
* Have a Jira user with product access to Jira, but make sure it has no permissions within the project pointed by the mail handler;
* Send an email with attachment to Jira from the email address that belongs to the user created in the previous step.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will look into the default reporter to create the issue along with its attachments.

h3. Actual Results

Jira creates the issue, but won't create the attachment.

The following message may be added as a comment in the new issue:
{noformat}
Reporter (<username>) does not have permission to create attachments in project <project key>. Following attachments found in the email have been discarded:
* attachment.extension
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Grant the *Create Attachments* permission to users that don't have access to the target project. You don't have to grant other permissions to those users.
fields.summary: Mail handler's default reporter will not create attachments for Jira users
